nodeMetric.field_description: Specific to Google Analytics, a Hit counts common interactions, such as page tracking, event tracking, and e-commerce tracking. Hits allow marketers to extend beyond Pageviews and define their own rules.

body.summary: Specific to Google Analytics, a Hit counts common interactions, such as page tracking, event tracking, and e-commerce tracking. Hits allow marketers to extend beyond Pageviews and define their own rules.

field_related_metrics.field_description: Page Views, as commonly used with Google Analytics, is the count of times the content of a page is loaded or re-loaded.
Sessions with Event is the count of the number of Sessions in which at least one defined Event is triggered. Marketing teams use this to evaluate the quality of the sessions on their website.
Website Events, or simply Events, are specific to Google Analytics and count the number of defined interactions or behaviours that are independent of a basic page load.
